greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of partitions of n for which the sum of the squares of the parts is k (n>=0, k>=0).
comment: Number of entries in row n = 1 + n^2.
Sum of entries in row n = A000041(n).
link: Guo-Niu Han, An explicit expansion formula for the powers of the Euler Product in terms of partition hook lengths, arXiv:0804.1849 [math.CO], 2008.
example: Row 3 is 0,0,0,1,0,1,0,0,0,1 because in the partitions of 3, namely [1,1,1], [2,1], [3], the sums of the squares of the parts are 3, 5, and 9, respectively.
maple: g := 1/(product(1-t^(k^2)*x^k, k = 1 .. 100)): gser := simplify(series(g, x = 0, 15)): for n from 0 to 8 do P[n] := sort(coeff(gser, x, n)) end do: for n from 0 to 8 do seq(coeff(P[n], t, j), j = 0 .. n^2) end do; # yields sequence in triangular form
mathematica: m = 8; CoefficientList[#, t]& /@ CoefficientList[1/Product[(1 - t^(k^2)* x^k), {k, 1, m}] + O[x]^m, x] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 19 2019 *)
results.author: _Emeric Deutsch_, Dec 06 2015
